alert.note: Alert for Lonoke (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 02 at 11:14PM CST until January 03 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CST FOR NORTHEASTERN CLEVELAND...SOUTHEASTERN PRAIRIE...SOUTHEASTERN LONOKE...NORTHWESTERN DESHA...CENTRAL JEFFERSON...LINCOLN AND ARKANSAS COUNTIES... At 1113 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Linwood to near Whitefield to Cane Creek State Park to near Plantersville, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluff... Stuttgart... Dumas... Star City... Altheimer... Gould... Gillett... Humphrey... Grady... Mitchellville... Almyra... Ulm... Whitefield... Little Bayou Meto Park... Woodville... Douglas... Stuttgart Municipal Airport... Herbine... Nebo... Feenyville... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CST for eastern and southeastern Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 300 AM CST for southeastern Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
